author: Jack Davis
title: Media Go On Fact-Checking Spree After Trump Cites Depth Of His Support
text:
Media Go On Fact-Checking Spree After Trump Cites Depth Of His Support "... falsely claimed ..." Share on Facebook 774 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
As President Donald Trump made the point to the crowd attending the Conservative Political Action Conference that the media would use anything it could to make him look bad, the point was illustrated to perfection. 
During one Trumpian rhetorical flight during his Friday speech in National Harbor, Md., the president was equating the size of the CPAC crowd with his Election Day support. 
“And our victory was a win for everyone who believes it’s time to stand up for America, to stand up for the American worker and to stand up for the American flag. Yeah, there we should stand up. Come on. There we should stand up. OK. And by the way, we love our flag,” Trump said. Advertisement - story continues below 
“By the way, you folks are in here — this place is packed , there are lines that go back six blocks, and I tell you that because you won’t read about it, OK,” Trump said. 
That line drew a laugh. 
“But there are lines that go back six blocks, there is such love in this country for everything we stand for, you saw that on Election Day,” he said. Advertisement - story continues below 
“And you’re going to see it more and more. So we’re all part of this very historic movement, a movement the likes of which, actually, the world has never seen before. There’s never been anything like this. There’s been some movements, but there’s never been anything like this,” Trump added. 
After the speech, Trump’s comments were taken as a literal crowd estimate. 
The Hill devoted a story to saying Trump “falsely claimed … that lines to get in stretched back ‘six blocks.'” The story reported the general sense of calm outside the hall where Trump spoke. 
Jezebel’s The Slot chimed in, saying, “For what it’s worth, National Harbor isn’t six blocks wide or long.” Advertisement - story continues below 
CNBC also joined in the fact checking. Trump says lines "go back 6 blocks" for his speech &"you won't read about that" 
Press pool says the line appeared to be less than 1 block pic.twitter.com/t5XzQLCRyT 
— Steve Kopack (@SteveKopack) February 24, 2017 
Some on Twitter featured images from the venue where CPAC was held showing there were no lines outside as if there was a need to take Trump’s figurative statement and disprove it. These are the entrances to the hotel where Trump just claimed people were lined up six blocks waiting to get in #CPAC2017 pic.twitter.com/zoYUAXS4sy 
— Gabrielle Bluestone (@g_bluestone) February 24, 2017 
Trump’s style of being figurative over being literal was shown in the speech, which often used the media as a foil, during one riff on how they would report Trump’s reception at CPAC. 
“You know the dishonest media, they’ll say, ‘He didn’t get a standing ovation.’ You know why? No — you know why? Because everybody stood and nobody sat. So they will say, ‘He never got a standing ovation,’ right? They are the worst,” Trump said. 
“So — sit down,” Trump then commanded, to a wave of laughter. “‘Donald Trump did not get a standing ovation.’ They leave out the part, ‘They never sat down.’ They leave that out.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
